text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I want to share
with you my recipe for stuffing and this
is a recipe I go to year in year out
because my husband absolutely loves it
and when I came up with this recipe I
came up with - I came up with it with
two things in mind
number one what once one of my favorite
flavor combination
that's easy sausage peppers and onions I
love that combination and like I said
before I mean I make obviously sausage
pepper and onion sandwiches I'm super
I'm a pasta I mean you name it so this
was something that I was really into
from day one but I also thought about
this recipe because I do use turkey
sausage in it which I thought how
brilliant if you don't want to bother
making the whole big bird for the big
day this really does serve as a side
dish or as a main because it's got your
stuffing any turkey all in one so I hope
you give this recipe a try before we get
to talk about that we got to go over the
ingredients so let's get started you're
gonna need some stale bread some chopped
up onions celery red bell peppers some
garlic some turkey sausage which I've
taken out of the casing some chicken
stock some unsalted butter poultry
seasoning of course a little bit of
olive oil salt and pepper that's it the
ingredients are very simple and you can
really make stuffing out of anything you
have on hand just make sure you always
have some stale bread some chicken stock
and then you can play around with it
like you wouldn't believe
now the bread I'm using for this is some
just French bread it was cheap $0.99
but you want to make sure it's stale so
I bought it a couple days ago and now
it's perfect because if you were to use
fresh bread it would the consistency the
texture just wouldn't be right so that
it's done cut into little cubes like so
if you like your stuffing if you're used
to buying stuffing mix for stuffing mix
from your grocery store in the bags then
you know the tubes are so small so if
you prefer that then you can cut this as
small or spine as you like I like big
chunks
I like homemade stuffing I like the
texture I think it's awesome first thing
you wanna do is get your oven to 400 get
that ready for you and now what we're
going to do of course you want to prep
all your veggies I have taken the case
out of taking the sausage out of the
casing this is turkey sausage Italian
turkey sausage you can use um you know
obviously you can use pork sausage but
I'm choosing to use Turkey because like
I mentioned this is also a great main
course for the big day if you choose to
do something like this instead of a big
bird okay let's go to the stove and
start cooking I have a large skillet
here with high sides or a medium-high
heat with about a tablespoon and a half
of olive oil in the tablespoon of butter
that I've melted together and getting to
be nice and hot and add in my sausage
and just using a wooden spoon just going
to break it up just want to break up
your sausage and this isn't cooking for
about two minutes it's nowhere near
fully cooked but this is the perfect
time to add in my veggies because I want
this all to cook together to get really
nice and flavorful add them all in
season with a little salt and pepper and
then I'm going to just let this cook for
about five to seven minutes or until the
veggies begin to cook down and develop a
little color this is what you're looking
for for the veggies to start cooking
down they still have some texture which
is great now we're going to add in some
poultry seasoning poultry seasoning is
just a blend of different herbs I'm
going to let this cook for another 30
seconds just to kind of wake up those
herbs and I'm going you back at the
counter to assemble that looks wonderful
and I can tell you a smells even better
I love this so now I'm going to just put
this mixture right on top of my bread
cut that in there and now we're going to
add in some stock now this is completely
up to you if you like your stuffing
really really soggy then you can put as
much stuff as you want but if you like
it a little bit on the crispy side and
not as dense then you would have used
you know less stock I use um I would say
use about between two and a half to
three cups and I'm just mixing
everything up with a spatula or a wooden
spoon a bit more stock
little by little I don't want to overdo
it and it's going to be really difficult
to take it out that's perfect for me now
I'm just going to put this into a little
more big casserole dish get it all out
don't spill any like I did now I want to
give you a quick tip if you're anything
like me I love to cook but I don't like
to clean up after what I suggest you do
for the big day is you buy those
aluminum containers or you can cook
everything in and then you can just
throw them out when you're done so that
you have got little cleanup to do so now
that's my tip for the day I'm going to
take this butter that I had leftover
which is about a tablespoon and I'm just
going to dot this all over the top not
too much and this is a much more of a
figure friendly stuffing than normally
that you would normally get I mean
stuffings got at least a stick of butter
in it at which we're not doing that and
you also have a feel tiny bit better
about eating it but it's the holidays
this is the time to indulge right so
this is great I'm going to put this into
the oven 400 for about 20 to 25 minutes
or until the top is nice and crispy and
then we're going to stir it up my
stuffing baked for about 25 minutes and
I look cool just a little but now it's
time to eat love this I love that the
top is nice and crunchy but it's so
